00038 /************************** PRIVATE VARIABLES *************************/
00039 uint8_t menu[]=
00040         "********************************************************************************\n\r"
00041         "Hello NXP Semiconductors \n\r"
00042         "RTC Calibration demo \n\r"
00043         "\t - MCU: LPC17xx \n\r"
00044         "\t - Core: ARM CORTEX-M3 \n\r"
00045         "\t - Communicate via: UART0 - 115200 bps \n\r"
00046         "This example describes how to calibrate RTC \n\r"
00047         "********************************************************************************\n\r";

00051 void RTC_IRQHandle(void);

00053 /*----------------- INTERRUPT SERVICE ROUTINES --------------------------*/
00054 /*********************************************************************/
00059 void RTC_IRQHandler(void)
00060 {
00061         uint32_t secval;
00062 
00063         /* This is increment counter interrupt*/
00064         if (RTC_GetIntPending(LPC_RTC, RTC_INT_COUNTER_INCREASE))
00065         {
00066                 secval = RTC_GetTime (LPC_RTC, RTC_TIMETYPE_SECOND);
00067 
00068                 /* Send debug information */
00069                 _DBG ("Second: "); _DBD(secval);
00070                 _DBG_("");
00071 
00072                 // Clear pending interrupt
00073                 RTC_ClearIntPending(LPC_RTC, RTC_INT_COUNTER_INCREASE);
00074         }
00075 }
00076 
00077 /*-------------------------PRIVATE FUNCTIONS------------------------------*/
00078 /*********************************************************************/
00083 void print_menu(void)
00084 {
00085         _DBG(menu);
00086 }
00087 
00088 /*-------------------------MAIN FUNCTION------------------------------*/
00089 /*********************************************************************/
00094 int c_entry (void)
00095 {
00096         /* Initialize debug via UART0
00097          * – 115200bps
00098          * – 8 data bit
00099          * – No parity
00100          * – 1 stop bit
00101          * – No flow control
00102          */
00103         debug_frmwrk_init();
00104 
00105         // print welcome screen
00106         print_menu();
00107 
00108         /* In this example:
00109          * Suppose that the RTC need periodically adjust after each 5 second.
00110          * And the time counter need by incrementing the counter by 2 instead of 1
00111          * We will observe timer counter after calibration via serial display
00112          */
00113         // Init RTC module
00114         RTC_Init(LPC_RTC);
00115 
00116         /* Enable rtc (starts increase the tick counter and second counter register) */
00117         RTC_ResetClockTickCounter(LPC_RTC);
00118         RTC_Cmd(LPC_RTC, ENABLE);
00119 
00120         //Set current time = 0
00121         RTC_SetTime (LPC_RTC, RTC_TIMETYPE_SECOND, 0);
00122 
00123         /* Setting Timer calibration
00124          * Calibration value =  5s;
00125          * Direction = Forward calibration
00126          * So after each 5s, calibration logic can periodically adjust the time counter by
00127          * incrementing the counter by 2 instead of 1
00128          */
00129         RTC_CalibConfig(LPC_RTC, 5, RTC_CALIB_DIR_FORWARD);
00130         RTC_CalibCounterCmd(LPC_RTC, ENABLE);
00131 
00132         /* Set the CIIR for second counter interrupt*/
00133         RTC_CntIncrIntConfig (LPC_RTC, RTC_TIMETYPE_SECOND, ENABLE);
00134 
00135     /* Enable RTC interrupt */
00136     NVIC_EnableIRQ(RTC_IRQn);
00137 
00138     /* Loop forever */
00139     while(1);
00140     return 1;
00141 }
00142 
00143 
00144 /* With ARM and GHS toolsets, the entry point is main() - this will
00145    allow the linker to generate wrapper code to setup stacks, allocate
00146    heap area, and initialize and copy code and data segments. For GNU
00147    toolsets, the entry point is through __start() in the crt0_gnu.asm
00148    file, and that startup code will setup stacks and data */
00149 int main(void)
00150 {
00151     return c_entry();
00152 }

00157 *                               where the CHECK_PARAM error has occurred.

00159 * @param[in]    line assert_param error line source number
00160 * @return               None
00161 *******************************************************************************/
00162 void check_failed(uint8_t *file, uint32_t line)
00163 {
00164         /* User can add his own implementation to report the file name and line number,
00165          ex: printf("Wrong parameters value: file %s on line %d\r\n", file, line) */
00166

00168         while(1);
00169 }
